education_schemes.scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Special Scholarship Scheme For The Students Of Union Territories Of Jammu & Kashmir And Ladakh
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Provide financial assistance to students from J&K and Ladakh for higher education outside the UTs
Support meritorious students in securing admission in government colleges/institutions

benefits.disbursement: Academic fees paid directly to institution; maintenance allowance via DBT in 9-10 installments

eligibility_criteria: Domicile of Union Territories of J&K or Ladakh
Passed Class 12th from JKBOSE or CBSE-affiliated schools in J&K or Ladakh
Family income not exceeding ₹8,00,000 per annum
Admitted through AICTE counseling under supernumerary quota (except medical courses)
For lateral entry: Passed Diploma in Engineering from recognized polytechnic institutes in J&K or Ladakh
exclusions: Candidates pursuing courses through Open Universities
Candidates pursuing Diploma or Post Graduate courses

steps: Visit https://www.aicte-india.org/bureaus/jk/2021-2022
Click on 'PMSSS 2021-22 Registration' or 'Diploma Registration (2022-23)'
Fill mandatory fields including personal details, educational qualifications, and income details
Register and verify via email link
Sign in at https://aicte-jk-scholarship-gov.in/, provide required details, and upload documents
Submit application

documents_required: Domicile certificate of J&K or Ladakh

education_schemes.scheme_name: Swami Vivekananda Single Girl Child Fellowship for Research in Social Sciences
objectives: Support higher education of single girl child in Social Sciences
Promote small family norms
Recognize and promote single girl child norm in society

benefits.fellowship: ₹25,000/- per month for initial two years; ₹28,000/- per month for remaining tenure
benefits.contingency: ₹10,000/- per annum for initial two years; ₹20,500/- per annum for remaining tenure
benefits.tenure: 5 years or until Ph.D. thesis submission, whichever is earlier

eligibility_criteria: Single girl child without siblings (twin/fraternal daughters eligible)
Admitted to Ph.D. in Social Sciences in recognized Universities/Colleges/Institutes
Age up to 40 years for general category, 45 years for SC/ST/OBC/PWD
Pursuing regular, full-time Ph.D. program
exclusions: Candidates with siblings (if male sibling exists)
Pursuing Ph.D. in distance education mode

steps: Apply through UGC website: https://www.ugc.gov.in/
Fill and submit application form as per advertised instructions
Upload required documents

documents_required: Proof of age (Birth certificate or Class 10th marksheet)
Affidavit on ₹50/- stamp paper confirming single girl child status

education_schemes.scheme_name: CBSE Merit Scholarship Scheme For Single Girl Child
objectives: Recognize efforts of parents in promoting girls' education
Encourage meritorious single girl students to continue education in Classes 11th and 12th
eligibility_criteria: Single girl child of her family
Secured 60% or more marks in CBSE Class 10th examination
Studying in Class 11th or 12th in CBSE-affiliated school
Tuition fee not exceeding ₹1,500/- per month (₹6,000/- for NRI applicants)
Indian national

steps: Visit https://www.cbse.gov.in/
Register as new user or proceed with renewal
Fill roll number and date of birth as per Class 10th marksheet
Fill and attest undertaking and affidavit as per guidelines
Upload scanned undertaking and affidavit in PDF format
Submit application and print confirmation page
For renewal, courier confirmation page to CBSE Scholarship Office

documents_required: Affidavit on ₹50/- stamp paper confirming single girl child status

education_schemes.scheme_name: National Scholarship For Post Graduate Studies
objectives: Provide financial assistance to meritorious students from economically weaker sections for postgraduate studies
eligibility_criteria: Pursuing first postgraduate degree
Enrolled in first year of full-time postgraduate program
Under 30 years old
Pursuing recognized postgraduate degree program

steps: Visit National Scholarship Portal
Register as new applicant with mobile OTP
Fill application form with personal and academic details
Upload required documents
Submit application

documents_required: Attested mark sheets and certificates from Class 9th onwards
Provisional or final admission letter to PG course
Proof of identity (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Passport, PAN Card, Driving License)

education_schemes.scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana: Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme
objectives: Provide interest subsidy during moratorium period for education loans to economically weaker students
Support higher education in professional/technical courses

benefits.interest_subsidy: Full interest subsidy during moratorium period (course period + 1 year)

eligibility_criteria: Loans taken under IBA Model Education Loan Scheme
Gross parental/family income up to ₹4.5 lakhs per annum
Enrolled in NAAC/NBA accredited institutions or CFTIs for professional/technical courses
Admissible only once for UG or PG degree courses

steps: Visit nearest bank branch where education loan was availed
Submit application for interest subsidy with required documents
Nodal bank (Canara Bank) disburses subsidy via DBT through PFMS portal

education_schemes.scheme_name: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Diploma)
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Support specially-abled students to pursue technical education
Encourage preparation for a successful future through technical knowledge

benefits.duration: Up to 3 years for first-year students; 2 years for lateral entry

eligibility_criteria: Admitted to first or second year of diploma course in AICTE-approved institution
Disability of not less than 40%
Family income not exceeding ₹8,00,000/- per annum

steps: Visit https://scholarships.gov.in/
Register as new user, accept terms, and fill details
Login with application ID and password
Fill application form and upload documents
Submit application

education_schemes.scheme_name: Post Graduate Indira Gandhi Scholarship For Single Girl Child
objectives: Support postgraduate education of single girl children
Promote small family norms
eligibility_criteria: Single girl child without siblings (twin/fraternal daughters eligible)
Admitted to first year of regular, full-time Master’s degree course
Age not exceeding 30 years
Pursuing non-professional course

steps: Apply through National Scholarship Portal
Institution verifies online application
Submit required documents

documents_required: Proof of admission to Master’s degree course
Affidavit for single girl child status (Annexure-II)

education_schemes.scheme_name: Free Education For Sports Medal Winners / Participants Of National/International Events
objectives: Assist medal-winning sportspersons in pursuing higher education
Motivate excellence in sports and academics
eligibility_criteria: Medal winners of national games or participants in recognized international sporting events
Admitted to recognized Universities/Colleges/Institutions

steps: Download prescribed application form
Fill and attach certificate of participation/medal
Submit to designated authority

documents_required: Statement of selected students and receipt of scholarship

education_schemes.scheme_name: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
objectives: Support higher education of single girl children in any stream
Promote small family norms
Recognize single girl child norm in society

benefits.fellowship: ₹31,000/- per month (JRF) for 2 years; ₹35,000/- per month (SRF) for remaining tenure
benefits.tenure: 5 years or until Ph.D. thesis submission

eligibility_criteria: Single girl child pursuing Ph.D. in any stream
Registered in regular, full-time Ph.D. program
Age up to 40 years (general), 45 years (SC/ST/OBC/PWD)

steps: Visit https://frg.ugc.ac.in/
Register as new user, fill details, and upload photo/signature
Login with credentials, fill eligibility and PG/Ph.D. details
Submit application with affidavit for single girl child status

documents_required: Affidavit on ₹100/- stamp paper for single girl child status

education_schemes.scheme_name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
education_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
education_schemes.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD)
objectives: Support students with disabilities in Classes 9th and 10th
Enable SwDs to pursue education and earn a livelihood
eligibility_criteria: Studying in Class 9th or 10th in government or recognized school
Disability percentage of 40% or above
Family income not exceeding ₹2,00,000/- per annum
Not availing other government scholarships
Not the third sibling receiving this scholarship

steps: Visit https://scholarships.gov.in/
Register as new user, fill details, and submit
Login with application ID and password
Fill application form and upload documents
Submit application

education_schemes.scheme_name: Junior Research Fellowship
objectives: Provide financial support for doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences

benefits.fellowship_amount: ₹31,000/- per month for first 2 years; ₹35,000/- per month for next 3 years

eligibility_criteria: Indian citizen
Master’s degree in biotechnology or related field
Cleared GAT or NET exam
Age not exceeding 28 years (general/EWS) or 33 years (SC/ST/PH)
Pursuing full-time doctoral research

steps: Qualify Biotechnology Eligibility Test (BET)
Apply online on DBT website in July-August
Upload required documents
Appear for interview
Check final selection list on DBT website

education_schemes.scheme_name: Institutions of Eminence Scheme
objectives: Empower Higher Educational Institutions to become world-class
Enhance affordable access to high-quality education

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹1,000 crore for government institutions
additional_benefits: Freedom to mobilize resources from industry/alumni
Fix fees for foreign and domestic students
Exemption from government approvals for academic collaborations

eligibility_criteria: 10 selected institutions (mix of technical, management, and central universities)
Top 50 in NIRF category or top 500 in global rankings (Times, QS, Shanghai)

steps: Central government institutions apply through controlling Ministry/Department
State public universities apply through state government
Submit 15-year strategic vision plan and 5-year implementation plan

education_schemes.scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Vidyalaxmi (PM-Vidyalaxmi) Scheme
objectives: Provide financial support to meritorious students for higher education
Ensure no financial constraints prevent pursuit of quality education

benefits.loan_amount: No upper limit, covers course fees and associated expenses
benefits.interest_subvention: 3% for loans up to ₹10,00,000/- for family income up to ₹8,00,000/-

eligibility_criteria: Indian citizen, aged 18-23 years
Merit-based admission to one of 860 QHEIs
Pursuing technical/professional course
Passed 10th and 12th from government school
Not receiving other government scholarships
Family income up to ₹8,00,000/- for interest subvention

steps: Visit PM-Vidyalaxmi website, register with mobile/email OTP
Fill application form, choose bank/branch, and upload documents
Submit application and track status
Apply for interest subvention post-loan sanction

education_schemes.scheme_name: National Scheme Of Incentive To Girls For Secondary Education
objectives: Promote enrollment of girls aged 14-18 in secondary education
Reduce dropout rates and retain girls up to Class 12th

benefits.withdrawal: No premature withdrawal, matures at age 18

eligibility_criteria: Girl child from SC/ST or passed Class 8th from Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas
Enrolled in Class 9th in government, government-aided, or local body schools
Unmarried

steps: Register on National Scholarship Portal
Login, fill application form, and upload documents
Submit application
Track payment status via PFMS

documents_required: Certificate of two-year continuation in Class 9th

education_schemes.scheme_name: Post Graduate Scholarship for GATE/GPAT Qualified Students for Pursuing M.Tech/M.E./M.Pharm-UGC
objectives: Attract young talent to pursue postgraduate education in technical fields
eligibility_criteria: GATE/GPAT qualified
Admitted to M.E./M.Tech./M.Pharm or integrated dual degree program
Full-time scholar

steps: University submits claim on UGC portal
Upload undertaking and GATE/GPAT scorecard
Register on Canara Bank UGC portal
Scholarship disbursed via DBT

education_schemes.scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme For Girl Students (Technical Diploma)
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Empower women through technical education
Support girl students in pursuing diploma courses

benefits.duration: Up to 3 years for first-year students; 2 years for lateral entry

eligibility_criteria: Girl student pursuing first or second year of technical diploma
Family income not exceeding ₹8,00,000/- per annum
Maximum two girl children per family
From specified UTs/North Eastern States

steps: Register on National Scholarship Portal
Login, fill application form, and upload documents
Submit application
Track payment status via PFMS

education_schemes.scheme_name: Post Graduate Scholarships for Professional Courses for SC/ST Candidates
objectives: Provide financial assistance to SC/ST students for postgraduate professional courses

benefits.scholarship_amount: ₹7,800/- per month for ME/M.Tech; ₹4,500/- per month for other courses

eligibility_criteria: Belong to SC/ST category
Graduate degree in relevant subject
Admitted to first year of full-time postgraduate professional course
Enrolled in recognized university/institution

steps: Apply on National Scholarship Portal after UGC advertisement
Fill application form, upload documents
Institution verifies application
Scholarship disbursed via DBT

education_schemes.scheme_name: Post Graduate Merit Scholarship Scheme For University Rank Holders At Under-Graduate Level
objectives: Promote and nurture talent
Reward meritorious students for pursuing postgraduate studies

benefits.number_of_scholarships: 1800 for General Courses, 575 for Honours Courses

eligibility_criteria: First or second rank holder in General Courses or first rank in Honours Courses at UG level
Minimum 60% marks at UG level
Admitted to regular, full-time Master’s degree course
Age not exceeding 30 years

steps: Visit https://www.ugc.ac.in/
Select scheme under e-SARTS Scholarships-Fellowships
Fill application form and upload documents
Submit before deadline

education_schemes.scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme For Girl Students (Technical Degree)
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Empower women through technical education
Support girl students in pursuing degree courses

benefits.duration: Up to 4 years for first-year students; 3 years for lateral entry

eligibility_criteria: Girl student pursuing first or second year of technical degree
Family income not exceeding ₹8,00,000/- per annum
Maximum two girl children per family
From specified UTs/North Eastern States

steps: Register on National Scholarship Portal
Login, fill application form, and upload documents
Submit application
Track payment status via PFMS

education_schemes.scheme_name: AICTE-Swanath Scholarship Scheme For Students
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Support orphans, wards of Covid-19 deceased parents, and wards of martyred Armed Forces personnel
Encourage pursuit of education in AICTE-approved institutions

benefits.duration: Up to 4 years for degree; 3 years for diploma

eligibility_criteria: Orphan, or ward of parents deceased due to Covid-19, or ward of martyred Armed Forces personnel
Family income not exceeding ₹8,00,000/- per annum
Studying in AICTE-approved degree/diploma courses
Not receiving other government scholarships

steps: Register on AICTE portal
Login, fill application form, and upload documents
Submit application

documents_required: Death certificates or certificate from Tehsildar/SDM (for orphans)
Death certificate mentioning Covid-19 cause (if applicable)

education_schemes.scheme_name: Post Graduate Scholarship Scheme for GATE/GPAT Qualified Students-AICTE
education_schemes.department: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
objectives: Support GATE/CEED qualified students in postgraduate technical programs

benefits.leaves: 15 days casual, 30 days medical, maternity leave as per norms

eligibility_criteria: Valid GATE/CEED score
Admitted to full-time M.E./M.Tech./M.Arch./M.Des. program
Within AICTE-approved intake

steps: Institute uploads student details on AICTE portal
Student collects Unique ID, logs in at https://pgscholarship.aicte-india.org/
Upload documents and submit
Institute verifies and approves candidature

education_schemes.scheme_name: National Means-Cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme
objectives: Award scholarships to meritorious students of economically weaker sections
Reduce dropout rates at Class 8th and encourage secondary education
eligibility_criteria: Parental income not exceeding ₹3,50,000/- per annum
Regular student entering Class 9th in government/government-aided/local body school
Minimum 55% marks in Class 7th (50% for SC/ST)
Pass State-level MAT and SAT with minimum 40% marks (32% for SC/ST)

steps: Register on National Scholarship Portal
Login, fill application form, and upload documents
Submit application
Track payment status via PFMS

education_schemes.scheme_name: Sanskrit Research Scholarship Scheme
objectives: Promote advanced academic research in Sanskrit
Support Ph.D. scholars in completing doctoral research
eligibility_criteria: Belong to General, SC, ST, or EWS category
High marks in NET exam
Registered for Ph.D. in Sanskrit at recognized university in Uttarakhand

steps: Obtain application form from Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy
Fill form and attach self-attested documents
Submit to Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy
Selection based on NET scores and reservations

education_schemes.scheme_name: National Overseas Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
education_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
education_schemes.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD)
objectives: Support students with disabilities for Master’s or Ph.D. abroad
Enable SwDs to overcome barriers and pursue higher education
eligibility_criteria: Admitted to Master’s/Ph.D. in accredited foreign university
Disability percentage of 40% or above
Age 35 years or less
Family income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/- per annum
Maximum two children with disabilities per family

steps: Download form from http://disabilityaffairs.gov.in/
Fill and send with documents to DEPwD, New Delhi
Applications accepted throughout the year

documents_required: Certificate of not availing other scholarships

education_schemes.scheme_name: Educational Assistance to the Children Studying in 1st to 7th and 8th to 10th Class
education_schemes.department: Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW)
objectives: Provide financial assistance to children of registered construction workers for school education

benefits.beneficiaries: Up to two children or wife of registered male worker

eligibility_criteria: Worker registered with MBOCWW
Children or wife enrolled in Classes 1st to 10th
Maximum two beneficiaries per family

steps: Download form from MBOCWW website
Fill form and attach self-attested documents
Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer
Obtain receipt of submission

documents_required: Proof of residence (Aadhaar, Passport, Driving License, Ration Card, Electricity Bill, or Gram Panchayat Certificate)

education_schemes.scheme_name: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
objectives: Provide additional financial assistance (scholarship) to OBC students of non-creamy layer for pursuing higher education after Secondary (X)/Senior Secondary (XII)
Supplement the cost of education in Government-recognized Polytechnic/ITI/College/University anywhere in India

benefits.scholarship_value: ₹1000 per month for 10 months in an academic session
disbursement: Directly credited to Aadhaar-linked bank account
Admissible only to students who passed the previous academic session
Dependent on fund availability in a financial year

eligibility_criteria: Belong to non-creamy layer of OBC as per Notification dated 16th December 2005 and amendments
Domicile of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Passed Secondary (Class X) or Senior Secondary (Class XII) from a recognized Board
Pursuing higher education in a recognized Institution/University
Limited to two children of the same parent/guardian (except in case of multiple births in second live birth)

Eligible courses include: Degree (Graduation/Post-Graduation), M.Phil, Ph.D., Post-Doctoral Programmes, Post-Graduate Diploma in Management/Medicine, Commercial Pilot License, CA/ICWA/CS/ICFA, Pharmacy, Nursing, LLB, BFS, Para-medical, Mass Communication, Hotel Management, etc.
Post Matriculation non-degree courses like ITI, 3-year Diploma in Polytechnic
Students pursuing Post-graduate courses in Medicine must not practice during the course
Scholarship awarded on a year-to-year basis, subject to passing the stage/year/semesters
Scholarship stopped if student fails a class for more than one year
Scholarship cancelled and recoverable if obtained by false statements
Scholarship refundable if studies are discontinued
exclusions: Students repeating the same stage/level of education in a different subject/stream (e.g., B.Sc. after B.A, M.A. in another subject)
Students pursuing another professional course after completing one (e.g., LLB after B.T/B.Ed)

Courses funded by Central/State Government or UT Administration (e.g., Aircraft Maintenance Engineering, Private Pilot Licence, Defence Academies, Pre-Examination Training Centre, distance education courses)
renewal: Renewed yearly if scholar secures promotion to the next higher class
Renewable for next academic year with medical certificate or sufficient proof for inability to appear in annual examination
Eligible for scholarship in promoted class per University/Institution regulations

steps: Register on NSP Portal (https://scholarships.gov.in/) using 'New Registration' icon
Receive Student Registration ID after successful registration
Login using 'Fresh Application' icon with Student Registration ID
Fill and submit the application form via 'Application Form' icon
Receive system-generated registration number for future reference
Applications invited in May-June via advertisement in leading newspapers and other media

documents_required: Certificates of Class X/XII, Diploma/Degree of qualifying examination
Caste Certificate signed by Revenue Officer (not below Tehsildar)
Non-creamy Layer Certificate signed by Revenue Officer (not below Tehsildar)
Receipt of acknowledgment of scholarship from previous year (for renewal)
Copy of marks statement counter-signed by Head of Institution (for renewal)
